com.google.mu.util

Class Substring.Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.mu.util.Substring.Pattern
  • Enclosing class:
    Substring

    public abstract static class Substring.Pattern
extends Object
    A substring pattern that can be matched against a string to find substrings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pattern() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Substring.Pattern after(Substring.Pattern delimiter)
      Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped within the substring following delimiter.
      Substring.Pattern before(Substring.Pattern delimiter)
      Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped within the substring before delimiter.
      Substring.Pattern between(Substring.Pattern open, Substring.Pattern close)
      Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped between open and close.
      Optional<String> from(String string)
      Matches this pattern against string, returning the matched substring if successful, or empty() otherwise.
      Optional<Substring.Match> in(String string)
      Matches this pattern against string, returning a Match if successful, or empty() otherwise.
      Substring.Pattern or(Substring.Pattern that)
      Returns a Pattern that fall backs to using that if this fails to match.
      String removeFrom(String string)
      Matches this pattern against string, and returns a copy with the matched substring removed if successful.
      String replaceFrom(String string, char replacement)
      Returns a new string with the substring matched by this replaced by replacement.
      String replaceFrom(String string, CharSequence replacement)
      Returns a new string with the substring matched by this replaced by replacement.
      Substring.Pattern toEnd()
      Returns a Pattern that will match from the substring matched by this to the end of the input string.
      Substring.Pattern within(Substring.Pattern scope)
      Returns a modified Pattern of this that matches within scope.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pattern

        public Pattern()

    • Method Detail

      • in

        public final Optional<Substring.Match> in(String string)
        Matches this pattern against string, returning a Match if successful, or empty() otherwise.

        This is useful if you need to call Substring.Match methods, like Substring.Match.remove() or Substring.Match.getBefore(). If you just need the matched substring itself, prefer to use from(java.lang.String) instead.

      • from

        public final Optional<String> from(String string)
        Matches this pattern against string, returning the matched substring if successful, or empty() otherwise. pattern.from(str) is equivalent to pattern.in(str).map(Object::toString).

        This is useful if you only need the matched substring itself. Use in(java.lang.String) if you need to call Substring.Match methods, like Substring.Match.remove() or Substring.Match.getBefore().

        Since:
        2.1

      • removeFrom

        public final String removeFrom(String string)
        Matches this pattern against string, and returns a copy with the matched substring removed if successful. Otherwise, returns string unchanged.

      • replaceFrom

        public final String replaceFrom(String string,
                                char replacement)
        Returns a new string with the substring matched by this replaced by replacement. Returns string as-is if a substring is not found.

      • replaceFrom

        public final String replaceFrom(String string,
                                CharSequence replacement)
        Returns a new string with the substring matched by this replaced by replacement. Returns string as-is if a substring is not found.

      • or

        public final Substring.Pattern or(Substring.Pattern that)
        Returns a Pattern that fall backs to using that if this fails to match.

      • toEnd

        public final Substring.Pattern toEnd()
        Returns a Pattern that will match from the substring matched by this to the end of the input string. For example: 
           String line = "return foo; // some comment...";
   String commentRemoved = first("//").toEnd().removeFrom(line).trim();
   assertThat(commentRemoved).isEqualTo("return foo;");

        To match from the beginning of the input string to the end of a pattern, use Substring.upToIncluding(com.google.mu.util.Substring.Pattern) instead.

        Since:
        2.2

      • before

        public final Substring.Pattern before(Substring.Pattern delimiter)
        Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped within the substring before delimiter. For example: last('/').before(last('/')) essentially finds the second last slash (/) character.
        Since:
        2.1

      • after

        public final Substring.Pattern after(Substring.Pattern delimiter)
        Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped within the substring following delimiter. For example: first('/').after(first('/')) essentially finds the second slash (/) character.
        Since:
        2.1

      • between

        public final Substring.Pattern between(Substring.Pattern open,
                                       Substring.Pattern close)
        Returns a modified Pattern of this scoped between open and close. For example: 
           first('=').between(first('{'), last('}'))
        finds the equals (=) character between the first and the last curly braces.
        Since:
        2.1

      • within

        public final Substring.Pattern within(Substring.Pattern scope)
        Returns a modified Pattern of this that matches within scope. For example: 
           first('=').between(first('{'), first('}'))
        is equivalent to 
           first('=').within(Substring.between(first('{'), first('}')))
        Since:
        2.1
